intro: Diodia glabra, commonly known as white diodia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands and along stream banks, preferring moist, sandy soils. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slight pubescence. Diodia glabra is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
